channel.title: Starting from scratch
channel.description:
well im new to the whole private server thing, and would like to start from scratch i noticed there are a lot of edited sources avalible but havent found any with 100% no edits, if possible how would i obtain a clean and 100 unedited source for me to start with and work with which i think will help me learn java at the same time as enjoying runescape private servers :D
thanks in advanced

item.title: Starting from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Wolfeyes217 Wolfeyes217
item.description:
@Wolfeyes217 wrote:

K this is really old lol

Read full topic

item.title: Starting from scratch
item.dc:creator: @MrWicked MrWicked
item.description:
@MrWicked wrote:

[quote=“protocol, post:12, topic:8490”]thus making new items redundant,unless you release a completely new client with each source or make the cache change every time you add new items to ur server? or wont there there be a compatiblity issue if people are using different clients? and no your offical one? there must be some way around these problems…

bit off topic but i would like to put your attentsion at this thread http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=12379.0[/quote]
Its actually extremely simple, and its not a hard task to create a new client.jar update every once in awhile.
Instead of making a shitty server and constantly having to restart the server or always adding new stuff in without bug testing, You spend 1 - 2 months on the server only yourself on it, adding and perfecting all of the features adding all the items you are going to use and even adding items that you plan on using in the future, etc. Its very simple, but I have thought of an idea, 1 Client that updates its information when Told by the server, which means you dont have to download a new jar with each item edit.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting from scratch
item.dc:creator: @protocol protocol
item.description:
@protocol wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath.v2, post:6, topic:8490”]If you want to make a server with NPC’s and stuff, you need to make your own client, because the cache is built in to the client.

MrWicked made a server called DrugScape like this.[/quote]

so the server relys on the client in theroy? so it doesnt really matter whats in the server becuase most of the actual images and code is from the cache stored on the client wont this result in nearly impossible updates like adding new items? means every client needs to be updated

surly there must be a way to do it the other way around making it more dynamic?

Read full topic

item.title: Starting from scratch
item.dc:creator: @protocol protocol
item.description:
@protocol wrote:

just a thought how are all these sources made, i take it no one has codded it 100% from scratch did some one decompile the cache or sumthing? been looking though nixscape thats the thing i kinda want to advoid the edited commands and what not, what to use a unedited to add in things bt not commands etc so the game play is still the same but with new npc, areas to explore. using nixscape means i gotta go through the fuse of deleting each command and seeing if it still works :S

Read full topic

item.description:

It just comes with some basic item commands for the admins.
